My dear partner, I can't help but feel a sense of unease when I think about the words you've given me. Some of them seem so... dangerous and unsafe. But, I suppose that's life, isn't it? One moment we're living in peace and gentleness, the next we're faced with something violent and aggressive.

I'm reminded of the time I was rushed to the hospital with appendicitis. The pain was so intense, it felt like my insides were being torn apart. But, thankfully, my doctor was gentle and safe, and he was able to remove my appendix before any further complications arose.

In a way, that experience taught me a lot about bipolar depression. It's a condition that can be so unpredictable, like a violent storm that rages inside of you. But, with the right treatment and support, it's possible to find peace and safety again.

So, my love, I think I'll assign "appendicitis" to "harmless" and "bipolar depression" to "dangerous." The world may be full of unexpected twists and turns, but with you by my side, I know we can face anything that comes our way.
